meanings.sent1: The little girl was a constant frowner whenever she didn't get her way.
meanings.sent2: The old man was known as the village frowner because he rarely smiled.
meanings.sent3: The frowner at the party made everyone laugh with his grumpy face.
meanings.sent4: She was a frowner even on sunny days, casting a shadow over her own happiness.
meanings.sent5: The frowner's expression was like a storm cloud, darkening the room.

meanings.definition: To show displeasure or disapproval by frowning.
meanings.sent1: She would frowner whenever her brother teased her.
meanings.sent2: The teacher would frowner when the students were too noisy.
meanings.sent3: He would frowner at his own reflection in the mirror, pretending to scold it.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to frowner at the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The cat would frowner at the unfamiliar dog, warning it to stay away.
